pr_title: Only init variable names to nil for output element variable

timeline.bodyText: Please add some unit tests for the different implementations.
timeline.author: saig0

timeline.bodyText: This check is done in completeJobs()
timeline.author: saig0
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -518,6 +521,48 @@ public void shouldIterateOverNestedInputCollection() {
         .containsExactlyElementsOf(INPUT_COLLECTION);
   }
 
+  @Test
+  public void shouldCollectNestedOutputElements() {
+    // given
+    ENGINE
+        .deployment()
+        .withXmlResource(
+            workflow(
+                miBuilder.andThen(
+                    m -> m.zeebeOutputElementExpression(OUTPUT_ELEMENT_EXPRESSION + ".nested"))))
+        .deploy();
+
+    final long workflowInstanceKey =
+        ENGINE
+            .workflowInstance()
+            .ofBpmnProcessId(PROCESS_ID)
+            .withVariable(INPUT_COLLECTION_EXPRESSION, INPUT_COLLECTION)
+            .create();
+
+    RecordingExporter.jobRecords(JobIntent.CREATED)
+        .withWorkflowInstanceKey(workflowInstanceKey)
+        .limit(INPUT_COLLECTION.size())
+        .exists();

timeline.bodyText:
What do you want to check here?
I think that we should verify that

the variable is created without .nested in its name (which is the issue that was fixed)
the variable is initialized with null
the values are collected in the output collection
timeline.author: saig0
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -518,6 +521,48 @@ public void shouldIterateOverNestedInputCollection() {
         .containsExactlyElementsOf(INPUT_COLLECTION);
   }
 
+  @Test
+  public void shouldCollectNestedOutputElements() {
+    // given
+    ENGINE
+        .deployment()
+        .withXmlResource(
+            workflow(
+                miBuilder.andThen(
+                    m -> m.zeebeOutputElementExpression(OUTPUT_ELEMENT_EXPRESSION + ".nested"))))
+        .deploy();
+
+    final long workflowInstanceKey =
+        ENGINE
+            .workflowInstance()
+            .ofBpmnProcessId(PROCESS_ID)
+            .withVariable(INPUT_COLLECTION_EXPRESSION, INPUT_COLLECTION)
+            .create();
+
+    RecordingExporter.jobRecords(JobIntent.CREATED)
+        .withWorkflowInstanceKey(workflowInstanceKey)
+        .limit(INPUT_COLLECTION.size())
+        .exists();
+
+    // complete job
+    completeJobs(
+        workflowInstanceKey,
+        INPUT_COLLECTION.size(),
+        i -> Map.of("nested", OUTPUT_COLLECTION.get(i)));
+
+    // then
+    final List<Long> scopeKeys =
+        RecordingExporter.variableRecords(VariableIntent.CREATED)
+            .withName(OUTPUT_ELEMENT_EXPRESSION)
+            .map(Record::getValue)
+            .map(VariableRecordValue::getScopeKey)
+            .limit(3)
+            .collect(Collectors.toList());
+    assertThat(scopeKeys)
+        .hasSize(3)
+        .allSatisfy(scopeKey -> assertThat(scopeKeys).containsOnlyOnce(scopeKey));

timeline.message:
chore(engine): resolve review commments

- remove unnecessary wait for jobs created
- alter test to check for null and output collection result
- add test to check no variables created for more complex expressions
- add tests for Expression.getVariableName

timeline.bodyText:
Limiting the records to a specific number is a bit unsteady. Instead, we can limit the records from creating a workflow instance to its completion/termination.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                        RecordingExporter.variableRecords(VariableIntent.CREATED)
          
          
            
                            .map(Record::getValue)
          
          
            
                            .map(VariableRecordValue::getName)
          
          
            
                            .limit(10))
          
          
            
                         RecordingExporter.records()
          
          
            
                            .limitToWorkflowInstance(workflowInstanceKey)
          
          
            
                            .variableRecords()
          
          
            
                            .map(Record::getValue)
          
          
            
                            .map(VariableRecordValue::getName))
timeline.author: saig0

+    // then
+    assertThat(

+                .map(Record::getValue)
+                .map(VariableRecordValue::getName)
+                .limit(10))
